meanings.definition: Not having enough people to do a job or task
meanings.sent1: The small group was shorthanded for the project.
meanings.sent2: The team felt overwhelmed as they were shorthanded for the event.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a challenge to be shorthanded during the busy season.
meanings.sent4: The office was shorthanded, making it difficult to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent5: Being shorthanded made the workload seem never-ending.

meanings.definition: Having fewer players on a team than the opposing team
meanings.sent1: The soccer team was shorthanded due to injuries.
meanings.sent2: The basketball team struggled as they were shorthanded in the final quarter.
meanings.sent3: It was comical to see the team being shorthanded during the match.
meanings.sent4: The chess player felt shorthanded against the grandmaster opponent.
meanings.sent5: Being shorthanded in the game put them at a disadvantage.
